00002 /*
00003  * CAEN V1718 USB/VME Bridge driver - 0.5
00004  *
00005  * Written by Stefano Coluccini (s.coluccini@caen.it) - CAEN SpA
00006  *
00007  * based on rio500.c by Cesar Miquel (miquel@df.uba.ar)
00008  *
00009  * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
00010  * modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
00011  * published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the
00012  * License, or (at your option) any later version.
00013  *
00014  * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
00015  * WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00016  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
00017  * General Public License for more details.
00018  *
00019  *
00020  *   TODO
00021  *   - Precise identification of the device based on strings.
00022  *   
00023  * Changelog:
00024  *
00025  *   March 2007 rev 0.5
00026  *     - Port to 2.6.18 kernel: dev_fs no more supported
00027  *   September 2006 rev 0.4
00028  *     - Port to 2.6.15 kernel: struct usb_driver::owner field is no more supported
00029  *     - Port to 64-bit architectures : no changes (tested on 2.6.15-1.2054_FC5 SMP x86_64)
00030  *     - Unlocked ioctl() method alleviates system performacne problems ( Linux Version>= 2.6.11)
00031  *     - BugFix: disconnect_v1718 tried to down the same lock twice ( Linux Version >= 2.5.0 )
00032  *   May 2006  rev 0.3
00033  *     - Porting to 2.6.15 kernel: usb_class_driver::mode field is no more supported
00034  *   January 2006  rev 0.2
00035  *     - Porting to 2.6 kernel
00036  *     - V1718_IOCTL_REV: get driver revision
00037  *     - !!! WARNING !!! conficts with usbtest driver. Remove it!
00038  */

00058 /*
00059  * Version Information
00060  */
00061 #define DRIVER_VERSION "v0.5"
00062 #define DRIVER_AUTHOR "Stefano Coluccini <s.coluccini@caen.it>"
00063 #define DRIVER_DESC "CAEN V1718 USB/VME Bridge driver"
00064 
00065 #define V1718_MINOR_BASE   178
00066 
00067 /* stall/wait timeout for V1718 */
00068 #define NAK_TIMEOUT (HZ)
00069 
00070 #define IBUF_SIZE 0x10000       /* 64 kbytes */
00071 
00072 /* Size of the V1718 buffer */
00073 #define OBUF_SIZE 0x10000       /* 64 kbytes */
00074 
00075 /* we can have up to this number of devices plugged in at once */
00076 #define MAX_DEVICES     16
00077 //
00078 // Rev 0.2: added ini
00079 #include <linux/version.h>
00080 
00081 #ifndef VERSION
00082         #define VERSION(ver,rel,seq) (((ver)<<16) | ((rel)<<8) | (seq))
00083 #endif  
00084 
00085 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00086         
00087         #define USB_ST_TIMEOUT                  (-ETIMEDOUT)
00088         #define USB_ST_DATAUNDERRUN             (-EREMOTEIO)
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 // Rev. 0.4
00092 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)

00100 struct v1718_usb_data {
00101     struct usb_device *v1718_dev;   /* init: probe_v1718 */
00102 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00103     devfs_handle_t devfs;           /* devfs device */
00104 #endif          
00105     unsigned int ifnum;             /* Interface number of the USB device */
00106     int open_count;                 /* number of users */
00107     int present;                    /* Device is present on the bus */
00108     int minor;                      /* minor number for the device */
00109     char *obuf, *ibuf;              /* transfer buffers */
00110     char bulk_in_ep, bulk_out_ep;   /* Endpoint assignments */
00111     wait_queue_head_t wait_q;       /* for timeouts */
00112     struct semaphore lock;          /* general race avoidance */
00113 // Rev 0.4
00114 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00115     struct mutex           ioctl_lock;
00116 #endif
00117 };
00118 
00119 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00120         extern devfs_handle_t usb_devfs_handle; /* /dev/usb dir. */
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 /* array of pointers to our devices that are currently connected */
00124 static struct v1718_usb_data *minor_table[MAX_DEVICES];
00125 
00126 /* lock to protect the minor_table structure */
00127 static DECLARE_MUTEX (minor_table_mutex);
00128 //
00129 //Rev 0.2
00130 // static v1718_delete(struct v1718_usb_data *v1718)
00131 static void v1718_delete(struct v1718_usb_data *v1718)
00132 {
00133         minor_table[v1718->minor] = NULL;
00134         if( v1718->ibuf != NULL )
00135                 kfree(v1718->ibuf);
00136         if( v1718->obuf != NULL )
00137                 kfree(v1718->obuf);
00138         kfree(v1718);
00139 }

00141 // // Rev. 0.4
00142 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00143 static long unlocked_ioctl_v1718(struct file *, unsigned int, unsigned long);
00144 #endif

00146 static int open_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00147 {
00148         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = NULL;
00149         int subminor;
00150 //Dbg
00151 //info( "v1718 opening...\n");
00152 
00153 
00154         subminor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev) - V1718_MINOR_BASE;
00155         if( (subminor < 0) || (subminor > MAX_DEVICES) )
00156                 return -ENODEV;
00157 
00158         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00159 
00160         v1718 = minor_table[subminor];
00161         if( v1718 == NULL ) {
00162                 up(&minor_table_mutex);
00163                 return -ENODEV;
00164         }
00165 
00166         down(&v1718->lock);
00167 
00168         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00169 
00170         v1718->open_count++;
00171 
00172         init_waitqueue_head(&v1718->wait_q);
00173 
00174 // Rev. 1.6
00175 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00176         mutex_init(&v1718->ioctl_lock);
00177 #endif
00178         file->private_data = v1718;
00179 
00180         up(&v1718->lock);
00181 
00182 //      info("v1718 opened.");
00183 
00184 //Dbg
00185 //info( "v1718 opened...\n");
00186 
00187         return 0;
00188 }
00189 
00190 static int close_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00191 {
00192         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00193         int retval = 0;
00194         if( v1718 == NULL ) {
00195                 err("Close: object is null");
00196                 return -ENODEV;
00197         }
00198         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00199         down(&v1718->lock);
00200 
00201         if( v1718->open_count <= 0 ) {
00202                 err("Device not opened");
00203                 retval = -ENODEV;
00204                 goto exit_not_opened;
00205         }
00206 
00207         if( v1718->v1718_dev == NULL ) {
00208                 /* the device was unplugged before the file was released */
00209                 up(&v1718->lock);
00210                 v1718_delete(v1718);
00211                 up(&minor_table_mutex);
00212                 return 0;
00213         }
00214 
00215         v1718->open_count--;
00216 
00217 exit_not_opened:
00218         up(&(v1718->lock));
00219         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00220 
00221 //      info("v1718 closed.");
00222 //Dbg
00223 //info( "v1718 close...\n");
00224 
00225         return retval;
00226 }
00227 
00228 static int
00229 ioctl_v1718(struct inode *inode, struct file *file, unsigned int cmd,
00230             unsigned long arg)
00231 {
00232 //
00233 // rev 0.2
00234         int ret= 0;
00235         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00236         
00237         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00238         down(&(v1718->lock));
00239     /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00240     if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00241          v1718->present == 0 ||
00242          v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00243         {
00244                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00245                 return -ENOTTY;
00246         }
00247 
00248     switch (cmd) {
00249         case V1718_IOCTL_REV:
00250                         {
00251                                 v1718_rev_t rev;
00252                 if( copy_from_user(&rev, (v1718_rev_t *)arg, sizeof(rev)) > 0 ) {
00253                         ret = -EFAULT;
00254                         break;
00255                 }
00256                                 strcpy( rev.rev_buf, DRIVER_VERSION);
00257                 if( copy_to_user((v1718_rev_t *)arg, &rev, sizeof(rev)) > 0) {
00258                         ret = -EFAULT;
00259                         break;
00260                 }
00261                         }
00262                 break;
00263                 default:
00264                         ret= -ENOTTY;
00265                         break;
00266     }
00267         up(&(v1718->lock));
00268     return ret;
00269 }
00270 
00271 // Rev 0.4
00272 /*
00273         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00274 
00275         unlocked_ioctl_v1718 (Called in preference to ioctl_v1718 on newer kernels)
00276 
00277         ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00278 */
00279 
00280 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00281 static long unlocked_ioctl_v1718(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00282 {
00283         struct inode *inode = file->f_dentry->d_inode;
00284         struct v1718_usb_data *s = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00285         long ret;
00286 
00287         /* ioctl() calls can cause the Big Kernel Lock (BKL) to be taken, which
00288          * can have significant performance penalties system-wide.  By providing
00289          * an unlocked ioctl() method the BKL will not be taken, but the driver
00290          * becomes responsible for its own locking.  Furthermore, the lock can be
00291          * broken down per A2818 so that multiple threads accessing different CONET
00292          * chains do not contend with one another during ioctl() calls.
00293          */
00294         mutex_lock(&s->ioctl_lock);
00295         ret = (long) ioctl_v1718(inode, file, cmd, arg);
00296         mutex_unlock(&s->ioctl_lock);
00297 
00298         return ret;
00299 }
00300 #endif
00301 
00302 static ssize_t
00303 write_v1718(struct file *file, const char *buffer,
00304             size_t count, loff_t * ppos)
00305 {
00306         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00307 
00308         unsigned long copy_size;
00309         unsigned long bytes_written = 0;
00310         unsigned int partial;
00311 
00312         int result = 0;
00313         int maxretry;
00314         int errn = 0;
00315 
00316         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00317 
00318         down(&(v1718->lock));
00319         /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00320         if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00321              v1718->present == 0 ||
00322              v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00323         {
00324                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00325                 return -ENODEV;
00326         }
00327 
00328         do {
00329                 unsigned long thistime;
00330                 char *obuf = v1718->obuf;
00331 
00332                 thistime = copy_size =
00333                     (count >= OBUF_SIZE) ? OBUF_SIZE : count;
00334                 if (copy_from_user(v1718->obuf, buffer, copy_size)) {
00335                         errn = -EFAULT;
00336                         goto error;
00337                 }
00338 //              maxretry = 5;
00339                 maxretry = 1;   // TEMP - 1 volta e' sufficiente ?
00340                 while (thistime) {
00341                         if (!v1718->v1718_dev) {
00342                                 errn = -ENODEV;
00343                                 goto error;
00344                         }
00345                         if (signal_pending(current)) {
00346                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00347                                 return bytes_written ? bytes_written : -EINTR;
00348                         }
00349 
00350                         result = usb_bulk_msg(v1718->v1718_dev,
00351                                          usb_sndbulkpipe(v1718->v1718_dev, 2),
00352 //                                       obuf, thistime, &partial, 5 * HZ);
00353                                          obuf, thistime, &partial, 1 * HZ);     // TEMP - 1 sec basta?
00354 
00355                         dbg("write stats: result:%d thistime:%lu partial:%u",
00356                              result, thistime, partial);
00357 
00358                         if (result == USB_ST_TIMEOUT) { /* NAK - so hold for a while */
00359                                 if (!maxretry--) {
00360                                         errn = -ETIME;
00361                                         goto error;
00362                                 }
00363                                 interruptible_sleep_on_timeout(&v1718-> wait_q, NAK_TIMEOUT);
00364                                 continue;
00365 //Rev 0.2                               
00366 //                      } else if (!result & partial) {
00367                         } else if (!result && partial) {
00368                                 obuf += partial;
00369                                 thistime -= partial;
00370                         } else
00371                                 break;
00372                 };
00373                 if (result) {
00374                         err("Write Whoops - %x", result);
00375                         errn = -EIO;
00376                         goto error;
00377                 }
00378                 bytes_written += copy_size;
00379                 count -= copy_size;
00380                 buffer += copy_size;
00381         } while (count > 0);
00382 
00383         up(&(v1718->lock));
00384 
00385         return bytes_written ? bytes_written : -EIO;
00386 
00387 error:
00388         up(&(v1718->lock));
00389         return errn;
00390 }
00391 
00392 static ssize_t
00393 read_v1718(struct file *file, char *buffer, size_t count, loff_t * ppos)
00394 {
00395         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718;
00396         ssize_t read_count;
00397         unsigned int partial;
00398         int this_read;
00399         int result;
00400 //      int maxretry = 10;              // TEMP - Prova per abortire prima 
00401         int maxretry = 1;       
00402         char *ibuf;
00403 
00404         v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *)file->private_data;
00405 
00406         down(&(v1718->lock));
00407         /* Sanity check to make sure v1718 is connected, powered, etc */
00408         if ( v1718 == NULL ||
00409              v1718->present == 0 ||
00410              v1718->v1718_dev == NULL )
00411         {
00412                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00413                 return -ENODEV;
00414         }
00415 
00416         ibuf = v1718->ibuf;
00417 
00418         read_count = 0;
00419 
00420         while (count > 0) {
00421                 if (signal_pending(current)) {
00422                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00423                         return read_count ? read_count : -EINTR;
00424                 }
00425                 if (!v1718->v1718_dev) {
00426                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00427                         return -ENODEV;
00428                 }
00429                 this_read = (count >= IBUF_SIZE) ? IBUF_SIZE : count;
00430 
00431                 result = usb_bulk_msg(v1718->v1718_dev,
00432                                       usb_rcvbulkpipe(v1718->v1718_dev, 6),
00433                                       ibuf, this_read, &partial,
00434 //                                    (int) (HZ * 8));
00435                                       (int) (HZ * 1)); // TEMP - 1 secondo credo che basti 
00436 
00437                 dbg("read stats: result:%d this_read:%u partial:%u",
00438                        result, this_read, partial);
00439 
00440                 if (partial) {
00441                         count = this_read = partial;
00442                 } else if (result == USB_ST_TIMEOUT || result == 15) {  /* FIXME: 15 ??? */
00443                         if (!maxretry--) {
00444                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00445                                 err("read_v1718: maxretry timeout");
00446                                 return -ETIME;
00447                         }
00448                         interruptible_sleep_on_timeout(&v1718->wait_q,
00449                                                        NAK_TIMEOUT);
00450                         continue;
00451                 } else if (result != USB_ST_DATAUNDERRUN) {
00452                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00453                         err("Read Whoops - result:%u partial:%u this_read:%u",
00454                              result, partial, this_read);
00455                         return -EIO;
00456                 } else {
00457                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00458                         return (0);
00459                 }
00460 
00461                 if (this_read) {
00462                         if (copy_to_user(buffer, ibuf, this_read)) {
00463                                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00464                                 return -EFAULT;
00465                         }
00466                         count -= this_read;
00467                         read_count += this_read;
00468                         buffer += this_read;
00469                 }
00470         }
00471         up(&(v1718->lock));
00472         return read_count;
00473 }
00474 
00475 static struct
00476 file_operations usb_v1718_fops = {
00477         owner:          THIS_MODULE,            
00478         read:           read_v1718,
00479         write:          write_v1718,
00480         ioctl:          ioctl_v1718,
00481 // Rev. 0.4
00482 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,6,11)
00483         unlocked_ioctl: unlocked_ioctl_v1718,
00484 #endif
00485         open:           open_v1718,
00486         release:        close_v1718,
00487 };
00488 
00489 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00490 
00491 static struct usb_class_driver usb_v1718_class = {
00492   .name = "usb/v1718_%d",
00493   .fops = &usb_v1718_fops ,
00494 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE <= VERSION(2,6,13)
00495   .mode = S_IFCHR | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP ,
00496 #endif
00497   .minor_base = V1718_MINOR_BASE ,
00498 };
00499 
00500         
00501 static int probe_v1718(struct usb_interface *intf,
00502                          const struct usb_device_id *id)
00503 #else
00504 static void *probe_v1718(struct usb_device *dev, unsigned int ifnum,
00505                          const struct usb_device_id *id)
00506 #endif                                           
00507 {
00508 
00509 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00510         struct usb_device *dev = interface_to_usbdev(intf);
00511         int retval= 0;
00512 #endif
00513         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = NULL;
00514 // Rev 0.2      
00515 //      char name[12];
00516         int minor;
00517 
00518         info("CAEN V1718 found at address %d", dev->devnum);
00519 
00520         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00521         for( minor = 0; minor < MAX_DEVICES; ++minor ) {
00522                 if( minor_table[minor] == NULL )
00523                         break;
00524         }
00525         if( minor >= MAX_DEVICES ) {
00526                 info("Too many devices");
00527                 goto exit;
00528         }
00529 
00530         v1718 = kmalloc(sizeof(struct v1718_usb_data), GFP_KERNEL);
00531         if (v1718 == NULL) {
00532                 err("Out of memory");
00533                 goto exit;
00534         }
00535         memset(v1718, 0x00, sizeof(*v1718));
00536         minor_table[minor] = v1718;
00537 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00538         if( usb_register_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class))
00539         {
00540         err("probe_v1718: Not able to get a minor for this device.");
00541                 goto error;
00542         }
00543 #endif  
00544         v1718->present = 1;
00545         v1718->v1718_dev = dev;
00546         v1718->minor = minor;
00547 
00548         if (!(v1718->obuf = (char *) kmalloc(OBUF_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00549                 err("probe_v1718: Not enough memory for the output buffer");
00550                 goto error;
00551         }
00552         dbg("probe_v1718: obuf address:%p", v1718->obuf);
00553 
00554         if (!(v1718->ibuf = (char *) kmalloc(IBUF_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00555                 err("probe_v1718: Not enough memory for the input buffer");
00556                 goto error;
00557         }
00558         dbg("probe_v1718: ibuf address:%p", v1718->ibuf);
00559 
00560 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00561         v1718->devfs = devfs_register(usb_devfs_handle, "v1718_0",
00562                                       DEVFS_FL_DEFAULT, USB_MAJOR,
00563                                       V1718_MINOR_BASE + v1718->minor,
00564                                       S_IFCHR | S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP |
00565                                       S_IWGRP, &usb_v1718_fops, NULL);
00566         if (v1718->devfs == NULL)
00567                 dbg("probe_v1718: device node registration failed");
00568 
00569         init_MUTEX(&(v1718->lock));
00570 #else
00571 
00572         init_MUTEX(&(v1718->lock));
00573         usb_set_intfdata (intf, v1718);
00574         
00575 #endif  
00576         goto exit;
00577 
00578 error:
00579 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00580         usb_deregister_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class);
00581         retval= -ENOMEM;
00582 
00583 #endif
00584         v1718_delete(v1718);
00585         v1718 = NULL;
00586 
00587 exit:
00588         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00589 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00590         return retval;
00591 #else
00592         return v1718;
00593 #endif  
00594 }
00595 
00596 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00597 static void disconnect_v1718(struct usb_interface *intf)
00598 #else
00599 static void disconnect_v1718(struct usb_device *dev, void *ptr)
00600 #endif
00601 {
00602 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00603         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = usb_get_intfdata (intf);
00604 #else
00605         struct v1718_usb_data *v1718 = (struct v1718_usb_data *) ptr;
00606 #endif
00607         int minor;
00608 
00609         down(&minor_table_mutex);
00610         down(&(v1718->lock));
00611 
00612         minor = v1718->minor;
00613 
00614 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00615         usb_set_intfdata (intf, NULL);
00616         if (v1718) {
00617                 usb_deregister_dev(intf, &usb_v1718_class);
00618 //rev 0.4: BugFix
00619 //              down(&(v1718->lock));
00620                 if (v1718->open_count != 0) {
00621                         /* better let it finish - the release will do whats needed */
00622                         v1718->v1718_dev = NULL;
00623                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00624                 } else {
00625                         up(&(v1718->lock));
00626                         v1718_delete(v1718);
00627                 }
00628         }
00629 #else
00630         devfs_unregister(v1718->devfs);
00631 
00632         if (v1718->open_count != 0) {
00633                 /* better let it finish - the release will do whats needed */
00634                 v1718->v1718_dev = NULL;
00635                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00636         } else {
00637                 up(&(v1718->lock));
00638                 v1718_delete(v1718);
00639         }
00640 #endif
00641 
00642         info("CAEN #%d V1718 disconnected.", minor);
00643 
00644         up(&minor_table_mutex);
00645 }
00646 
00647 static struct usb_device_id v1718_table [] = {
00648         { USB_DEVICE(0x0547, 0x1002) },                 /* CAEN V1718 */
00649         { }                                             /* Terminating entry */
00650 };
00651 
00652 MODULE_DEVICE_TABLE (usb, v1718_table);
00653 
00654 // Rev 0.4
00655 static struct usb_driver v1718_driver = {
00656 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0) & LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,6,15)
00657         owner:          THIS_MODULE,
00658 #endif  
00659         name:           "v1718",
00660         probe:          probe_v1718,
00661         disconnect:     disconnect_v1718,
00662 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00663         fops:           &usb_v1718_fops,
00664         minor:          V1718_MINOR_BASE,
00665 #endif  
00666         id_table:       v1718_table,
00667 };
00668 
00669 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00670 static int __init usb_v1718_init(void)
00671 #else
00672 static int usb_v1718_init(void)
00673 #endif
00674 {
00675         if (usb_register(&v1718_driver) < 0)
00676                 return -1;
00677         info(DRIVER_VERSION ":" DRIVER_DESC);
00678 
00679         return 0;
00680 }
00681 
00682 
00683 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= VERSION(2,5,0)
00684 static void __exit usb_v1718_cleanup(void)
00685 #else
00686 static void usb_v1718_cleanup(void)
00687 #endif
00688 {
00689 //Dbg
00690 //printk( "usb_v1718_cleanup enter ...\n");
00691         usb_deregister(&v1718_driver);
00692 //Dbg
00693 //printk( "usb_v1718_cleanup leave ...\n");
00694 }
00695 
00696 module_init(usb_v1718_init);
00697 module_exit(usb_v1718_cleanup);
